title: 19.5% Efficiency organic solar cells enabled by a direct Câ€“H arylation-derived wide-bandgap small-molecule guest donor
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE02551B, Paper
Bin Hu, Shenzheng Gao, Xin Wang, Fan Cao, Yiyu Chen, Jianqi Zhang, Laju Bu, Xin Song, Guanghao Lu
A tin-free asymmetric small-molecule guest donor (oPhFO) with a wide bandgap allows PM6:oPhFO:BTP-ec9 ternary OSCs to reach a champion efficiency of 19.5% by optimizing blend morphology and vertical phase separation as well as reducing energy loss.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
